text.div:
Care Connect RESTful API

  • Implementation Guide Version: 0.0.1
  • FHIR Version: 4.0.1
  • Supported Formats: application/fhir+json, application/fhir+xml
  • Supported Patch Formats:
  • Published on: Tue Mar 26 00:00:00 GMT 2019
  • Published by: NHS England

Note to Implementers: FHIR Capabilities

Any FHIR capability may be 'allowed' by the system unless explicitly marked as "SHALL NOT". A few items are marked as MAY in the Implementation Guide to highlight their potential relevance to the use case.

SHALL Support the Following Implementation Guides

  • https://nhsconnect.github.io/CareConnectAPI/

FHIR RESTful Capabilities

Mode: server

Summary of System-wide Interactions

Capabilities by Resource/Profile

Summary

The summary table lists the resources that are part of this configuration, and for each resource it lists:

  • The relevant profiles (if any)
  • The interactions supported by each resource (Read, Search, Update, and Create, are always shown, while VRead, Patch, Delete, History on Instance, or History on Type are only present if at least one of the resources has support for them.
  • The required, recommended, and some optional search parameters (if any).
  • The linked resources enabled for _include
  • The other resources enabled for _revinclude
  • The operations on the resource (if any)
Resource TypeProfileRSUCSearches_include_revincludeOperations

Binaryhttp://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Binaryy

Encounterhttps://fhir.hl7.org.uk/StructureDefinition/UKCore-Encounteryydate, patient, patient:identifier
Immunizationhttps://fhir.hl7.org.uk/StructureDefinition/UKCore-Immunizationyydate, patient, patient:identifier, status

Medicationhttps://fhir.hl7.org.uk/StructureDefinition/UKCore-Medicationyycode

MedicationStatementhttps://fhir.hl7.org.uk/StructureDefinition/UKCore-MedicationStatementyyeffective, patient, patient:identifier, status

Organizationhttps://fhir.nhs.uk/England/StructureDefinition/Organizationyyidentifier, name
Patienthttps://fhir.nhs.uk/England/StructureDefinition/Patientyyaddress-postalcode, birthdate, email, family, gender, given, identifier, name, phone, name+gender, name+birthdate, family+gender, given+gender
Practitionerhttps://fhir.hl7.org.uk/StructureDefinition/UKCore-Practitioneryyaddress-postalcode, identifier
PractitionerRolehttps://fhir.hl7.org.uk/StructureDefinition/UKCore-PractitionerRoleyyidentifier, organization, practitioner
Procedurehttps://fhir.hl7.org.uk/StructureDefinition/UKCore-Procedureyydate, patient:identifier, patient, subject, patient+date
ValueSethttp://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/ValueSety

title: Care Connect RESTful API
description:
*This is NOT an official R4 version of the Care Connect RESTful API. This is an experimental FHIR R4 conversion of the current [INTEROPen Care Connect RESTful API](https://nhsconnect.github.io/CareConnectAPI/).* 

 For official guidance on interoperability Open API standards including *NHS Standard Contract requirements* see [https://www.england.nhs.uk/digitaltechnology/connecteddigitalsystems/interoperability/](https://www.england.nhs.uk/digitaltechnology/connecteddigitalsystems/interoperability/) 

 The Care Connect RESTful APIs within this site have been developed collaboratively by NHS Digital and the INTEROPen community. These APIs aim to better support the delivery of care by opening up information and data held across different clinical care settings through the use of nationally defined INTEROPen FHIR® resources. 

 The INTEROPen vision is to create a library of nationally defined HL7® FHIR® resources and interaction patterns that implementers can adopt to simplify integration and interoperability within UK health and social care.

searchParam.name: clinical-status
searchParam.documentation: active | inactive | resolved

searchParam.name: date
searchParam.documentation: Date record was believed accurate

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Who the sensitivity is for

searchParam.name: patient:identifier
searchParam.documentation: Who the sensitivity is for

interaction.documentation:
The Binary will be returned in a native format (i.e. not contained within a FHIR resource) if no MIME type is not specified, an appropriate MIME type is included or a wild card (*/*) is included within the request header.

Common health related MIME types are listed below:

| Image/Document Type |	MIME Type |
|------|-------|
| html |text/html |
| pdf | application/pdf |
|dicom | application/dicom |
|png | image/png |
|jpg | image/jpeg |
|FHIR Documents|	application/xml+fhir or application/json+fhir |

 Although this page is describing a FHIR Binary endpoint, a Binary resource can be retrieved from any url. If a FHIR Binary endpoint is used then the resource SHALL be available as both a Binary resource and as a standard URL resource. The default behaviour is that of a URL resource

 For Binary resources, the result of a query are different when compared to the rest of FHIR. There are specific ways to indicate the format of the response expected by the server. This is via the client specifying the format of the response either via a _format override on the query parameter of by using a “content-type” HTTP header in the request.
